detailsOfAchievement: The Foundation is proactively engaging multiple and multi-dimensional extension activities that cover social and village welfare, education, water and soil management, and conservation, among others. Some of the major activities are summarised below. Village Development Agenda GRF has adopted five villages; namely, Vakod which is the birth place of Dr. Bhavarlal Jain, Jabhol, Mohadi, Takarkheda and Shirsoli and has undertaken comprehensive development programmes there. Between 10 adn 16 January, 2009, a village development programme was held at Vakod. Youth from all the adopted villages participated in the programme. Diverse activities like personality development, awareness about village development model, forest conservation and protection, civic rights and responsibilities, modern agricultural practices, organic farming, water and soil management, religious tolerance and brotherhood, de-addiction, labour of love, hygiene and sanitation, etc. were included in the programme. A similar programme was also held in Jalgaon on 10 and 11 January, 2011, at Jain Hills. Gram Shilpi (Rural Sculptors) As an outcome of the above programmes, a youth brigade of Gram Shilpis or Rural Sculptors has been established, which is enthusiastically volunteering in the Foundationâ€™s various activities. The brigade is growing in strength and numbers day by day. This brigade undertook a tour of central and northern Gujarat in early March of 2010 and imparted training and orientation related to water and soil management, community health and hygiene, literacy, child care and development, village development, etc. In north Gujarat, this brigade raised a collective of around 25,000 tribals and trained them in agricultural and economic self-reliance, drip irrigation, cooperative marketing, etc. A major highlight is that in the arid border area of Tharad in Banaskantha district, local farmers created a network of water reservoirs in 150,2016 acres of land and undertook water harvesting there. The initiative has transformed both the ecology and economy of the area, leading to all-round uplift of the hitherto hapless tribals. One brigade of Rural Sculptors visited Nanded on 12 July 2010 and obtained extensive information and knowledge about khadi industry. Nanded is a reputed khadi production centre in India. Education extension The Foundation has provided a wide range of assistance and aid to the education sector. These include facilities, equipments, sports implements, books, classroom furniture, laboratory instruments, and other infrastructural inputs to many educational institutions. Hygiene, cleanliness and sanitation drives The Foundation has initiated community drives related to hygiene practices, village cleanliness and best practices in sanitation. On Labour Day, May 1, 2010, one such drive was organised at Shirsoli village with enthusiastic participation from village dwellers. Watershed and other water management initiatives Water is the elixir of all life on earth, but man has been rampantly misusing, exploiting and wasting this finite and precious natural resource. Gandhiji used to lay great emphasis on water conservation and management and zealously advocated its judicious and canalised use in all walks of life. GRF is committed to advance this cause. In the opinion of Dr. Bhavarlal Jain, agriculture is the single largest consumer of water â€“ our per capita requirement of drinking water is just 2-5 litres per day, while the same for food requirement is 2000-5000 litres. Hence, if only 5% saving is realised in agriculture usage of water, it can meet the entire worldâ€™s water need of the growing urban and industrial sectors. Water management projects are already undertaken by GRF. A 200-feet check dam between Takarkheda and Kadholi Shivrala villages has been completed. Going forward, it is expected that this will be a thrust area for GRF. Foot marches and cycle rallies It would not be inappropriate to say that Gandhiji literally walked his way to independence. Foot marches got India its freedom. In Gandhijiâ€™s scheme of things, foot marches were a vital part of Satyagraha, or passive, non-violent resistance. Gandhiji utilised this method because apart from being a very healthy practice, foot marches offered various benefits to the satyagraha movement. Since such processions were more like walkathons, they offered very close and intimate encounters with the masses spread along the entire route of the procession. Such an effective means of mass contact helped in spreading Gandhijiâ€™s message and the freedom wave across the length and breadth of the country. This created a nation-wide ground-swell of potent, non-violent energy, which ultimately became the strength of the independence movement. The Foundation, in its own way, is utilising walkathons and cycle rallies as agents of change to create awareness about Gandhiji and his ideals amongst the masses. A walkathon was undertaken between 20 and 30 April, 2011, in which enthusiasts from all the five adopted villages participated. A 310-kilometer foot march was undertaken between Faizpur and Nandurbar, to celebrate the 75th year of the national convention of the Indian National Congress held at Faizpur in 1936. Imparting of Gandhian ideals, propagation of Khadi, sale of Gandhian literature, and other activities were undertaken during the rally. A cycle rally with similar objectives was held between 30th January and 12th February, 2012. It traversed between Jalgaon and Prakasha (Shahada), a distance of 232 kilometres. During the rally, programmes were held at 31 schools in which â€˜Gandhiâ€™ film was shown, and the photo exhibition â€˜Mohan to mahatmaâ€™ was displayed. Lecture series The Foundation organises purposeful activities under this head and uses them as opportunities of dialogue, debate and interactive events between the stage and the audience. The subjects are wide and diverse, and they include not only established, mainstream Gandhian issues and concerns, but also peripheral ones. As early as in 2006, a lecture series was organised on the occasion of a century of Gandhijiâ€™s first satyagraha in South Africa in jalgaon, on 11th September. Another notable event was the â€˜Freedom Fighter Namdevrao Choudhary Lecture Seriesâ€™ held in Jalgaon between 8 and 11 October, 2007. The event was inaugurated by Shri Ashok Bhau, and lectures were given by a host of distinguished speakers from different fields of knowledge. Around ten such major lecture series were organised between 2007 and 2010, with prominent Gandhians and luminaries from other fields spoke effusively in the presence of an august audience. Mohan to Mahatma photo-exhibition The Foundation is in possession of over 5000 pictures from Gandhijiâ€™s life, covering all major activities and events. This has been documented, compiled and converted into a mobile photo-exhibition named â€˜Mohan to Mahatmaâ€™. The exhibition is displayed in schools and other educational institutions free of cost. Till date, over 1,50,000 students in over 50 educational institutions have seen the exhibition, and hopefully, gained a valuable insight into Gandhijiâ€™s life and ideals through this medium. Gandhi Katha Distinguished Gandhian and thinker Narayanbhai Desai, who is the son of long-time secretary of Gandhiji Mahadevbhai Desai, has evolved a unique story-telling means to spread the message of Gandhiji to the masses. This is in the form of â€˜Gandhi Kathaâ€™ or The Life Story of Gandhiji, told live from a dais in an engaging, lyrical style. The Foundation had organised Gandhi Katha at Jalgaon between 4 and 8 October 2009. The event was a big success, and was attended by a distinguished gathering from Jalgaon and far-away places. Sale of Gandhian literature and Khadi The Foundation has its own sales cell from where these items are availed to visitors and other interested persons. A wide range of books and and by Gandhiji are available at the cell. The cell has also become known for its imaginative and wide collection of khadi material. Due to this, it is possible to use these materials in many innovative ways and combinations and come up with sleek, contemporary costumes and ensemble for both men and women.

detailsOfAchievement: Organisation is working for health and rights of Male Sex Worker (MSW), male having sex with Male (MSM) and Transgender (TG). Five years in to health and development services, GAURAV today has extended service delivery beyond Mumbai to nagpur and Aurangabad districts of maharashtra with annual outreach of 6000+ high risk key population being reached through HIV service delivery, care support and treatment and social-legal protection services. Major Activities: Outreach HIV prevention, Testing and Treatment STI prevention and Treatment Counselling and Psychological Support Health Check-ups and Health Camps Networking and linkages with public health facilities ART and Tuberculosis linkages Advocacy and Sensitization meetings and Workshops condom and Lubricant distribution capacity building/ Training and mentoring help line Crisis Management

The world has spent a year and a half battling the COVID-19 pandemic.Dr.Gautam Bhansali has worked for the Government of Maharashtra,he is in charge of the BMC Coordination Committee for Private Hospitals and has been working tirelessly for the last 18 months.With this aid the Foundation has provided Medical Treatment for affected patients, provided PPE kit to the healthcare staff,distributed masks,served food to the needy people,free supply of ration,providing cash allowance to healthcare staff

Dr. Gautam Bhansali is known for his philanthropic work and services .He is a well-experienced consultant physician and has vast clinical research experience in infectious and tropical diseases , like dengue , malaria , chikungunya, tuberculosis, Coronavirus . Golden Hour Foundation also helps poor patients by giving them free treatment and paying the hospital bills of patients who cannot afford it. He has participated as a speaker and has also been a guest for various seminars and conferences.

detailsOfAchievement: Activities Nos. 01. â€™â€™ Vasundhara IWMP â€“ 17 (GP-10) Ministry of Rural Development of Government of India In the leadership of GramVikas Sanstha and with the financial supports of the ministry of rural development of the India, GramVikas Sanstha is implementing the project of` â€œvasundharaâ€ integrated watershed management programmeâ€™. In respect of this project, the project area is to the south direction distance of 15 km. from Aurangabad city. This project included 12 villages with population of 11,013 and 6,426 Hector land. This project undertakes various activities including the trainings for capacity building, Natural resource management, Entry point activities, Livelihoods and women empowerment etc, are the major activities under this project. Activity Nos.02.Training Program Gramvikas sanstha is working in the field of providing training to the rural people of backward villages to develop their skill and to empower them so that they can be self dependent. Gramvikas Sanstha is doing the work of training since 2005 and we are committed to the society to give them training so that they can live the life with dignity. Gram vikas sanstha provides training in the field of women empowerment,Panchati Raj institute, Natural Resource Management and Livelihood training. Gramvikas sanstha is doing this work from the financial help of our other ongoing projects like Jalswarj, Apla Pani, Hiv/Aids control program,BRGF, RGSY, â€œVASUNDHARAâ€ Swarna Jayanti Gram swarojgar yojna etc. Till date Gramvikas sanstha has provided training to 19380 beneficiaries which cover the population of 360368 people. Activities Nos. 03. â€œAdarsha gaon sankalp va Prkalp â€œ (State Government of Maharashtra) GramVikas Sanstha Third activity is â€œAdarsha gaon sankalpâ€ (model Village) and praklap at Vawa village, located in Paithan Block in Aurangabad District. The Project is supported by the state government of Maharashtra. The project was started in 2011 and it is for the duration is of five years. The object of this project is to make the model village in the state of Maharashtra. To achieve the goal of project, GramVikas Sanstha is conducting and implementing various integrated activities to develop the village such as, activities are such as Natural resource management, soil and water conservations, plantation, entry point activities. Drainage, drinking water facilities, internal roads, hygiene & sanitations, providing facilities in the village for getting education, within the reach of village community. Activities Nos. 04. â€œDay Care Centre â€œ (Aurangabad Municipal Corporation) GramVikas Sanstha Implementing Day Care Centre at Naregaon in Municipal Corporation area of Aurangabad .This project is supported by the municipal corporation of Aurangabad (AMC). The project started in August 2011. The project objectives are to take care of childrenâ€™s who belongs to below poverty line. As well as childrenâ€™s whose parents are doing work on daily wages. Day Care Centre includes the following activities, it takes care of the childrenâ€™s, facility of plays toys & games, education facility, this activities help in overall development of the children. The Day care Center organize parents meetings, organize health check- up camp, â€œkishoriâ€ life skill development trainings, gathering, Anandvihar camp, annual picnic, computer trainings etc. At â€œDay care centreâ€ morning breakfast, lunch, and snacks at evening are also provided. At present GramVikas Sanstha is getting very positive outcome from this project

detailsOfAchievement: The year 2014-15 has been seen GSMT has undertaken 28 projects and direct interventions in more than 327 villages from 19 blocks of three districts namely Amravati Chandrpur and Yavatmal. The total outreach during the years has been at least with 40644 households and 203218 people. GSMT has worked with various constituency groups including small and marginal farmers women youth tribals and children person with Disabilities FSW MSM Migrant for their welfare support and empowerment. A total of 38 Community Forest Rights claimes have been sanctioned by the District Level Committee. Total 8318.42 ha. Of forest come to 38 villagers for management. Section 4 one e committee have been formed at the village level in 10 villages and capacity building programmes under taken for committee and Gramsabha members. In five villages Forest management plans were prepare by Gram sabhas. A total of 78 families have received gas cylinders through the forest department. 33 Biodiversity Management Committees BMC have been formed and 15 BMCs have opened bank accounts. Plantation of 27000 sap lings in Awalgaon forest under MREGA. A total 26600 farmers from the villages are undertaking various capacity building program. 3292 farmers have been trained under Better Cotton System in cotton focus on reduction of fertilizers and pesticides and to undertake better marketing. A total of 121 learning group have been formed out of which 121 have been approved under better cotton initiative. Community based support and rehabilitation of people with disabilities and children with disabilities. Provision of services and support of PLHIV including migrant labourers female sex workers FSW and men having sex with men MSM and efforts to halt and reverse the prevalence of HIV AIDS. Community based monitoring CBM GSMT was consultant organization for state healh system resource center under evaluation of community based monitoring and planning of health care services under NRHM for five districts in Vidarbha. A total of 106 children of female sex workers have benefited by Anand Balsadan and are undergoing mainstream education in different schools. Moreover nine girls from Anand Balsadan have been admitted to nursing course. Previously three girls from here have completed nursing course and have jobs in a private hospital in Pune. Three boyes are pursuing their higher education and two girls have completed ITI training. 16 children in Anandbalsaddan have received Adhar cards.

detailsOfAchievement: The organization runs primary to PG level education in various fields. The organization has given more emphasis on Technical and Vocational education to rural peoples of this district. Poor and backward pupils are given benefit of many Government schemes for their education. Organization runs technical education from 8th standard through the technical school. After Post SSC Diploma in Engineering in Polytechnic are run. Post HSC Degree Engineering courses and Agriculture courses are run.
